definition[0]: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc
example[0]: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
example[1]: Short term contracts are now the norm with some big companies.
definition[1]: the usual and expected situation, way of doing something etc
example[2]: Private businesses award an average of 0.35% commission compared with the industry’s norm of 0.5%.
example[3]: Budget surpluses are now the norm.
